page.title: 11The Churches in Sampford
page.content: {The Methodist Chapel}dates from 1933 and still used. It is part of the Hatherleigh circuit. {The Parish Church of Saint Andrew }was entirely rebuilt about 1450.The Rood Screen has been reconstructed from fragments and replaced in the south aisle.The barrel ceiling has several splendidly carved bosses.There is an old chest made from a solid piece of oak which was probably the one placed in the Chancel to receive the Communion Alms as required by the First English Prayer Book of 1549.This is what started the Prayer Book Rebellion. The church shares a Rector with Exbourne,Honeychurch and Jacobstowe. As in the other villages congregations are dwindling and mainly the elderly.
